meanings.definition: To look or stare angrily or sullenly.
meanings.sent1: He glowers at his brother when he is upset.
meanings.sent2: She always glowers when she doesn't get her way.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy cat glowers at the new puppy.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds glower ominously in the sky.
meanings.sent5: His teacher's disapproving glower made him nervous.

meanings.sent1: Her glower could be seen from across the room.
meanings.sent2: The child's glower showed his displeasure.
meanings.sent3: The glower on his face disappeared when he saw the surprise.
meanings.sent4: The dark forest had a mysterious glower about it.
meanings.sent5: The villain's menacing glower sent shivers down her spine.
